thread.title: AREA COLLEGES: Stonehill women's cross country team wins seventh straight NE-10 title
thread.title_full: AREA COLLEGES: Stonehill women's cross country team wins seventh straight NE-10 title

author: The Enterprise
title: AREA COLLEGES: Stonehill women's cross country team wins seventh straight NE-10 title
text: Posted Oct. 25, 2015 at 8:16 PM Updated at 8:19 PM Posted Oct. 25, 2015 at 8:16 PM Updated at 8:19 PM The Stonehill College women’s cross country team continued its dominance in the Northeast-10 Conference on Sunday. The Skyhawks, ranked 16th in the national Division 2 poll, won their seventh straight NE-10 championship and 14th overall in race held in Colchester, Vt. Stonehill, the top-ranked team in the East Region, had 23 points, well ahead of second-place Bentley University (116). Junior captain Nicole Borofski of Plymouth led the way for the Skyhawks by winning the six-kilometer race in 21:48.8. Second place went to teammate Aisha McAdams, a junior who completed the course in 22:32. Three other runners were also in the top 10 for Stonehill, including freshman Makenzie Cyr (fifth), junior Alexandra Buonfiglio (seventh) and Elizabeth Hannon (eighth). Junior Alexandra Grimaldo was 23th and freshman Jillian Caiazzi took 24th for the Skyhawks. Stonehill is idle until Nov. 8 when it takes part in the NCAA Division 2 East Regional race in Hopkinton, N.H. Men’s cross country Stonehill second: The Skyhawks finished behind champion American International College at the NE-10 Championships. Stonehill had six runners in the top 30, led by Robert Massey, who was fifth. He was followed by Joseph Santo (10th), Daniel Gordon (14th), Riley Dowd (21st) Antonio Xelhua (22nd) and Tyler Henseler (30th). Women’s tennis Adelphi 5, Stonehill 2: The Skyhawks (13-4) were unable to defend the NE-10 championship, losing to the Panthers in the title round in West Hempstead, N.Y. The match was even, 2-2, before Adelphi won three times in singles to secure its first NE-10 title. Analise Kump won at No. 3 singles for Stonehill, 6-3, 6-1, and paired with Victoria Barbetta for an 8-6 win at No. 2 doubles. By The Enterprise
